intro: Cranfillia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cranfillia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
